Article Title: Zubeen death: Fest organiser, manager held; sent to 14-day custody
Article Text:
Zubeen Garg

Assam Bids Final Farewell To Zubeen Garg As Wife Garima Breaks Down By His Pyre

Zubeen’s aides booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder

GUWAHATI: Two fugitive prime accused in the probe into Zubeen Garg’s death were arrested before dawn on Wednesday and sent to police custody for 14 days, while the music icon’s 13th-day mourning rituals drew massive crowds in Jorhat, with fans crying for justice.North East India Festival organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta was detained by immigration officers at New Delhi airport around 12.30am after arriving from Singapore on the basis of an Interpol lookout notice, officials said, and handed to Assam police. An hour later, Garg’s manager Siddharth Sharma was caught near the Delhi-Haryana border in Gurgaon.Both were flown to Guwahati, produced before the chief judicial magistrate at the judge’s residence due to Durga Puja court closures, and remanded in police custody for 14 days.Security was tightened at Guwahati airport, along the convoy route, and at the magistrate’s residence, with Assam police and RAF personnel deployed. Photographs released by police showed Mahanta and Sharma in handcuffs inside a police van. DGP Harmeet Singh said: “The investigation is progressing well.”Assam police’s SIT has charged the duo with conspiracy, culpable homicide not amounting to murder, and causing death by negligence.“Interrogation has started and we are going to do everything as per law,” said Munna Prasad Gupta, special DGP (CID) heading the nine-member SIT. He said investigators had seized the two men’s mobile phones along with Garg’s own handset, which was with his manager.Over 60 FIRs have been filed demanding a full probe, 55 of them naming four men: Mahanta; manager Sharma, an employee of a Mumbai-based talent management firm; drummer Shekharjyoti Goswami, and businessman Sanjive Narain.SIT has interrogated Goswami, the singer’s cousin and police officer Sandipon Garg, actress Nishita Goswami, and singer-actress Amritprabha, all of whom were in Singapore at the time. Interpol lookout notices were earlier circulated for Mahanta and Sharma after they ignored SIT summons to appear before Oct 6.Garg’s widow Garima Saikia Garg said in Jorhat she was relieved the duo had been brought to Assam. “We are all waiting to know what happened to him in his last moments,” she said. In her FIR, she alleged Mahanta failed to provide security, medical support, or proper accommodation for Garg in Singapore.
Article Summary: North East India Festival organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta was detained by immigration officers at New Delhi airport. Garg’s manager Siddharth Sharma was caught near the Delhi-Haryana border in Gurgaon. Both were flown to Guwahati, produced before the chief judicial magistrate at the judge's residence due to Durga Puja court closures.

Article Title: Mid-air clash: UP MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh pushed by passenger on Air India flight; flyer booked
Article Text:
Representative Image

Poll Do you think the passenger's behavior towards the MLA was justified? Yes, it was justified. No, it was not justified.





LUCKNOW: A 26-year-old passenger was booked by Sarojininagar police following a mid-air altercation with an Gauriganj MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh aboard Air India flight AI 837 from Delhi to Lucknow.Passenger, Samad Ali of Fatehpur, was returning from Jeddah via connecting flight.According to Singh, Ali used abusive language while talking on phone. When Singh confronted Ali, he allegedly argued with the MLA and pushed him.After arriving in Lucknow, Singh reported the incident to the police and lodged a formal complaint. Authorities said the man has been taken into custody for questioning.Singh, a three-term MLA from Gauriganj Sadar, first won his assembly seat in 2012.
Article Summary: A 26-year-old passenger was booked by Sarojininagar police following a mid-air altercation with an Gauriganj MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh aboard Air India flight AI 837 from Delhi to Lucknow. Authorities said the man has been taken into custody for questioning.

Article Title: 'Threats of false cases': Ex-AAP worker accuses Punjab minister of sexual harassment
Article Text:
Balbir Singh

PATIALA: A former AAP women’s wing functionary has filed a sexual harassment complaint in a Patiala court against Punjab health minister Dr Balbir Singh, who has denied the charges and said that he will “file a reply in the court”.In her Sept 29 petition before CJM, the woman accused Singh of repeated harassment, molestation and intimidation, and named his son, close aides, a local party neta and AAP Punjab unit as co-accused in a criminal conspiracy to threaten and defame her.She alleged unwelcome advances, demands for sexual favours, threats of false cases, spyware on her phone and circulation of defamatory material. She sought registration of a criminal case and the arrest of all the accused.
Article Summary: Former AAP women’s wing functionary has filed a sexual harassment complaint in a Patiala court against Punjab health minister Dr Balbir Singh. Singh has denied the charges and said that he will ‘file a reply in the court’

Article Title: J&K: Govt teacher booked under POCSO Act in Rajouri; at large after suspension
Article Text:
Representative image

JAMMU: A government school teacher in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir was suspended and later booked under POCSO Act on Tuesday for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl student, officials said, adding that he is currently on the run.“Following the incident, the students staged protests against the teacher, prompting senior officials of education department to rush to the school at Kakora in the district on Tuesday,” officials said.“The protest was later called off around 5:30 pm after the suspension order and the FIR,” they said.The suspension order cited “allegations of a grave nature”.The teacher, identified as Ajaz Ahmad, is currently absconding and a police manhunt has been launched.
Article Summary: A government school teacher in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir was suspended and later booked under POCSO Act. The suspension order cited “allegations of a grave nature” The teacher, identified as Ajaz Ahmad, is currently absconding and a police manhunt has been launched.

Article Title: Bihar assembly elections: Two more parties join Mahagathbandhan; seat-sharing deal to get complex?
Article Text:
PM Modi’s 'Kosi' Jibe at Opposition Ignites Bihar Election Heat During MP Flats Inauguration

NEW DELHI: The seat-sharing negotiations for upcoming assembly elections in Bihar have become more complex as two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The situation is getting trickier as major parties are firm on their seat demands.The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.“Two more parties are expected to be part of the INDIA bloc soon and we all have to sacrifice our share of seats to accommodate the new partners.” State Congress president Rajesh Kumar told reporters after a discussion during a key meeting of INDIA bloc leaders at the official residence of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav.Meanwhile, Congress insist that it cannot go below the 70 seats.VIP chief Mukesh Sahani, on the other hand, has demanded “60 seats plus the post of deputy CM” while the CPI-ML is pressing for at least 40 seats, pointing to its past performance.The RJD is also unwilling to contest on fewer than 150 seats.In 2020 assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal had contested on 144 seats, of which it won 75.Congress won 19 out of 70 seats.CPI-ML contested 19 seats and won 12.CPM contested 4 seats and was successful in winning 2 seats.CPI contested on 6 seats and won 2 seats.RJD's Tejashwi Yadav has already declared himself as the CM face of the opposition INDIA bloc.Addressing the rally in Ara town, the last stopover of the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra', Tejashwi questioned the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar for "frequently copying his ideas" and described it as a "copycat government". Ridiculing the government for copying his ideas, he said that at present he was moving ahead while the govt was behind him."Tejashwi aage-aage, Sarkar pichhe-pichhe. Original CM chahiye ki duplicate?" (Tejashwi is moving ahead while the govt is following him from behind. Do you want a duplicate CM or the original CM?), Tejashwi asked the crowd.
Article Summary: Two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.

Article Title: MP: Man axed over property dispute; police make complainant wash car while brother lies bleeding
Article Text: BHOPAL: Police in Bhind district have been accused of making a complainant wash a vehicle while his injured brother lay bleeding outside the station. The incident was reported from Daboh police station on Tuesday night.According to reports, Shyamu Parihar of Barthara village was attacked with an axe and sticks during a property dispute with his uncle Narayan Parihar and Komal Parihar. He was left bleeding when his brother Ramu rushed him to Daboh police station to file a complaint.The family alleged that instead of providing medical help or registering the case immediately, police asked them to wash a car belonging to a sub inspector. They claimed the FIR was lodged only after about an hour’s delay and further alleged that money was demanded for registering the complaint.The victim’s relatives have appealed to Superintendent of Police Asit Yadav, demanding action.
Article Summary: Incident reported from Daboh police station on Tuesday night. Shyamu Parihar of Barthara village was attacked with an axe and sticks. He was left bleeding when his brother Ramu rushed him to file a complaint. Family alleged that instead of providing medical help or registering the case immediately, police asked them to wash a car belonging to a sub inspector.
